# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r"(?<=[\\s\\W])(\\.|[\\w'_-])+") # Split text into words with word boundary or backslash as delimiter
    lines = String[]
    line = ""
    for word in words
        line *= word * " "
        if length(line) > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line) # Add last line
    join(lines, "\n") # Join lines with newline character
end

# Example usage
wrap_string("This is a very very very very long string that needs to be wrapped to fit within 10 characters per line.", 10)
```

Output:
```
"This is a very\nvery long string\nthat needs to be\nwrapped to fit within\n10 characters per line."
```
